siteMetadata.title: Blog by Guillaume Lambert
siteMetadata.subtitle: I gather here interesting articles about Javascript development

frontmatter.title: 04. Couting the Values - Part 1
frontmatter.description: In this module, we’ll take a closer look at the JavaScript world and the values in it. But before we can get to that, we need to address the elephant in the room. Is the JavaScript world even real?

frontmatter.title: 03. Values and Variables
frontmatter.description: We’ll kick off this module with a little code snippet. What do you expect it to do? We haven’t covered this yet so it’s okay if you’re not sure. Try to answer it using your current knowledge of JavaScript. Now I want you to take a few moments and write down your exact thinking process for each line of this code, step by step. Pay attention to any gaps or uncertainties in your existing mental model, and write them down too. If you have any doubts about it, try to articulate them as clearly as you can.

frontmatter.title: 02. The Javascript Universe
frontmatter.description: In the beginning was the Value. What is a value? It’s hard to say. This is like asking what a number is in math, or what a point is in geometry. A value is a thing in the JavaScript universe. Numbers are values — but so are a few other things, like objects and functions. However, many things, such as an if statement or a variable declaration, are not values.

frontmatter.title: 01. Mental Models
frontmatter.description: The goal of this exercise isn’t to introduce you to variables. We assume you’re already familiar with them. Instead, it is to make you notice and reflect on your mental model.
